turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Volksgemeinschaft.
turn.1: What is the foundation of the Volksgemeinschaft?
turn.2: Upon rising to power in 1933, the Nazis sought to gain support of various elements of society.
turn.3: What kind of social group was the Volksgemeinschaft based on?
turn.4: Their concept of "Volksgemeinschaft" was racially unified and organized hierarchically.
turn.5: What is an example of a racial trait of the Volk?
turn.6: This involved a mystical unity, a form of racial soul uniting all Germans, including those living abroad.
turn.7: what is the most important aspect of the Volk?
turn.8: Nevertheless, this soul was regarded as related to the land, in the doctrine of "blood and soil".
turn.9: Did the Volk have any contradictions?
turn.10: Indeed, one reason for "blood and soil" was the belief that landowner and peasant lived in an organic harmony.
